reviewText: Beautiful stories of the best olympics

The 1986 documentary film by Bud Greenspan about the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles, California, United States has for many become the benchmark by which all other sports documentaries are measured against. The late Jonah J. "Bud" Greenspan was a master of the sports documentary and produced a number of similar documentaries but 16 Days of Glory is the jewel in the crown. Few documentaries have been able to capture the personalities and their personal journey's so well. With great music and narration, you soon fall under this documentaries spell and become hooked on Bud Greenspan's work.
Got this for a friend who attended. He just love it. I put it to dvd for him also
Even though you can't order a new copy of this, it is available second hand through e-bay.  I just found the soundtrack I had been looking for for ages.  The video is there too!

The 16 Days of Glory series is amazing. It captures what the Olympics are truly about: stories of human strength, courage, and spirit played out in public. Above all, the willingness to give one's all and to challenge limits.
